#Text=João Teixeira Albernaz
#Text=I
#Text=For other people named João Teixeira , see João Teixeira ( disambiguation ) .
#Text=Map showing the recapture of Bahia from the Dutch , Atlas of Brazil ( 1631 )
#Text=I. Teixeira Albernaz

#Text=João Teixeira Albernaz I also referred to as João Teixeira Albernaz , the Elder ( Lisbon , late 16th century – c. 1662 ) , to distinguish him from his grandson , was the most prolific Portuguese cartographer of the seventeenth century .
#Text=His works include nineteen atlases , a total of two hundred and fifteen maps .
#Text=He stands out for the variety of themes , which record the progress of maritime and land exploration , particularly in the Portuguese colony of Brazil .

#Text=João Teixeira Albernaz belonged to a prominent family of cartographers whose work extended from mid-sixteenth century until the late eighteenth century , including his father Luís Teixeira , uncle Domingos Teixeira , brother Pedro Teixeira Albernaz and grandson João Teixeira Albernaz , the younger , as well as Estevão Teixeira . [ 1 ]
#Text=Biography
#Text=Detail of " Pequeno atlas do Maranhão e Grão-Pará " showing the city of Belém , Brazil , 1629

column1: #Text=João Teixeira Albernaz must have learned the craft from his father Luís Teixeira , starting his own work in the seventeenth century .

#Text=On 29 October 1602 he got his licence as master for " Nautical charts , astrolabes , compass needles and cross-staff " , having been examined by the royal chief- cosmographer , João Baptista Lavanha .

column1: #Text=Three years later , in 1605 , he was appointed cartographer for the Warehouse Guinea and India ( Casa da Mina and India ? ) , where he worked until the end of his life .

#Text=In the Archive of the Indies in Seville , there is a document recording his presence and also his brother , Pedro Teixeira in Madrid in order to design charts of Strait of St. Vincent and the Strait of Magellan .
#Text=In 1622 presented a petition to the post of chief cosmographer , but the post was passed over to Valentim de Sá .

#Text=In the late seventeenth century , in an opinion issued by Manuel Pimentel about the 1642 Atlas of Brazil , warns that errors in the first chart of this Atlas , which did not respect the boundary agreed between Portugal and Spain , concluding that the book was " no more than good paintings and illuminations " .
#Text=Works

#Text=His work is of great interest both for its breadth and variety , and for the record of the progress of discovery and Portuguese maritime and overland exploration , particularly with regard to Brazil .
#Text=His works amount to nineteen atlas , grouped and loose charts , in a total of two hundred and fifteen charts .
#Text=Those include :
#Text=c. 1616 – a copy of the codex titled " Rezão do Estado do Brasil " .
#Text=According to Francisco Adolfo de Varnhagen and Helio Vianna , only the charts of this codex are by João Teixeira .
#Text=1621 – Chart of the Strait of S. Vicente and Strait of Magellan , with his brother Pedro Teixeira de Albernaz
#Text=c. 1626 – " Livro que dá Rezão do Estado do Brasil " , containing twenty-two chats , being a larger copy of the earlier 1616

#Text=1630 – Atlas Taboas geraes de toda a navegação , divididas e emendadas por Dom Ieronimo de Attayde com todos os portos principaes das conquistas de Portugal delineadas por Ioão Teixeira cosmographo de Sua Magestade , anno de 1630 , manuscript in the Library of Congress . [ 2 ]

#Text=The first map , a world map summarizing the geographic knowledge at the time , presents a controversial Tordesillas line shifted to the west , incorporating the mouth of the Rio de la Plata and northeastern North America under Portuguese rule . [ 3 ]
#Text=Taboas geraes de toda a navegação Asia
#Text=map , João Teixeira Albernaz , 1630
#Text=1631 – Atlas of the State of Brazil , available in 1960 in the Map Collection of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Rio de Janeiro .
#Text=Covers thirty-six charts displaying frames , legend and shields or grantees of the Crown , are not met .
#Text=Have been sent by organizing D. Jerónimo de Athayde , the donee Captaincy of Ilhéus .

#Text=Contains several elements illuminating on the sugar industry , as well as representing the estuaries of the Rio de la Plata and the Amazon River , showing the patterns of demarcation between Spain and Portugal ;
#Text=1640 – Atlas of Brazil , composed of thirty-two letters on paper , that there are seven copies , of which the Historical Archives of the Ministry of Finance , Brazil .
#Text=Has the particularity of each letter is preceded by a sheet with explanatory text .

#Text=Codex exists in Torre do Tombo ( Description of the land around the sea of St. Cross , commonly called Brazil , by John Teixeira , cosmographer of His Majesty the year 1640 ) is currently editing a full-color facsimile , showing thirty and letters , the first representing the territory of Brazil and the rest of its coast , with details of the final course of rivers , islands , ports and fortifications .
#Text=1643 – Atlas Universal ( Livro vniversal das navegasões feito em Lisboa por Ioão Teixeira Cosmographo de Sva Magestade , Anno 1643 ) , " Universal Atlas " with eight charts .
#Text=Considered an exceptional artistic value , different from other Atlas of the author , because it presents essentially hydrographic information .
